Test Name: Fluorescence In Situ Hybridization (FISH) with chromosome-specific probes
Specimen Type: Peripheral blood, bone marrow, or tissue samples (fixed cell suspensions)
Purpose: Detection of genetic abnormalities using chromosome-specific fluorescence probes.
Container: Specimen tube/vial containing Carnoy’s fixative or freshly prepared 3:1 methanol-acetic acid
Equipment: Fluorescence microscope, denaturation/hybridization system, water bath (72 °C), certified pipettes
